Portfolio

Oso

GitHub

Oso is a Spanish-learning app that is based on flashcards and incorporates multiple forms of user interaction with both text and speech, using web speech API for TTS and STT. Built using React and styled with Semantic UI and CSS, Oso is designed to be a CRUD app and is supported by a flat data-structure utilizing JSON Server.

Oso provides the user a way to read, listen, and even speak in Spanish and be graded on their pronunciation.

Javascript, React, Semantic UI, Web Speech API

Hue Stock App

GitHub
HSA allows a user to select a stock market sector to track using a Phillips Hue bulb. Data is fetched via the AlphaVantage API, then the lightbulb color is set a shade of red or green depending on the current performance of the sector.
jQuery, Bootstrap, Phillips Hue API, AlphaVantage API

Interests

Outside of web development, I also enjoy tinkering with Raspberry Pi and Arduino projects. I've built a software-defined radio tuned to track aircraft via ADS-B signals, a Harry Potter lamp controlled via wand gestures, and an N64 emulator.


I'm a part of my community by volunteering with local organizations. At Park Center Nashville, I serve as the Treasurer of the Associate Board. Park Center's mission statement is to empower Nashvillians with mental illness and substance abuse problems. I also work with the Alzheimer's Association's Middle Tennessee chapter, where I am the Ambassador to Senator Lamar Alexander. As an Ambassador, I advocate for research and federal support that is vital to ending this disease.
